result.title: Call 1 results and description of selected pilot projects
result.description: D6.2 will describe the selection process and results of the first call for pilot proposals. Apart from statistics (number of submitted and accepted proposals, total budget, budget breakdown), it will also summarize the evaluation process. For all accepted projects, it will briefly describe them, including their goals and objectives and other relevant information, such as the planned use of the ELG in those projects. In addition, it will contain recommendations for the organization and administration of the second call.

result.title: M-Sec Integrated Prototype first release
result.description: EU leader: WLI; JP leader: KEIO A deliverable of a prototype-demonstrator nature. It is the outcome of the integration and porting activities of various functional components developed in WP4 (as well as third party open source modules) into a holistic, seamless and fully functional M-Sec prototype for smart cities. The deliverable is going to have two versions following the iterative approach described in section 3.1.1.

result.title: Data processing layer prototype
result.description: This deliverable describes the first iteration of the data processing layer resulting in a first prototype. Based on D4.1 and the parallel development of the resource management framework it lifts a first data processing engine on top of the resource management framework and implements a first version of the data storage infrastructure. This first prototype is evaluated against the first iteration of use case implementation (D6.2).

result.title: Quantify impact of resolution on European climate change
result.description: Quantify and further consolidate the impact of resolution on future European climate change (including changes in extreme and compound events in cooperation with WP2,10) obtained from all three approaches, and develop a novel measure of European modelling uncertainty by comparing the spread in climate projections from the ensemble of core integrations with that obtained from the multi-model runs performed here

result.title: Specification of the ELG platform architecture
result.description: The aim of D2.2, drafted in Task 2.1, is to provide a detailed description of the ELG architecture and the design of the core layer, i.e., the backend systems that constitute the system and the interactions among them, as well as their interactions with the base infrastructure (WP1), the user interface and support and maintenance components (WP3). The report will document the technical solutions envisaged (e.g., selection of the database, programming tools etc.). Open source solutions will be preferred. The design will be made in close collaboration with WP1, WP3, WP4 and WP5 to ensure that all ingredients of the platform will be consistently built.
